meanings.definition: Not paying attention or taking notice; inattentive.
meanings.sent1: The unheedful student missed important details in the lecture.
meanings.sent2: She was unheedful of the warning signs and got lost in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The unheedful driver ignored the stop sign and ended up in a funny situation.
meanings.sent4: His unheedful behavior towards safety precautions was like playing with fire.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of being unheedful can be quite serious.

meanings.definition: Failing to heed or take into consideration; neglectful.
meanings.sent1: Her unheedful attitude towards deadlines often led to unfinished projects.
meanings.sent2: The unheedful manager overlooked the importance of employee feedback.
meanings.sent3: Being unheedful of the weather forecast, he wore shorts on a cold day.
meanings.sent4: The unheedful decision to skip rehearsals proved costly during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The unheedful neglect of maintenance resulted in a broken down car.
